It's incredible to think He is able to watch over every single individual in the population of the entire world, but that is a subject for another day. We'll see how God protected us from things we weren't aware of. We'll be amazed at how he intervened so that we didn't receive the full repercussions of ill-fated decisions we made. We'll marvel at how many times he intercepted an attack from the enemy. The video will show how frail our lives are and what a protector our God is. Yet another reason to praise the Lord.

fields.verse: I love the Lord, for he heard my voice; he heard my cry for mercy. Because he turned his ear to me, I will call on him as long as I live. - Psalms 116:1‭-‬2 (NIV)
fields.content: A young couple bought an old house in need of major updating and upgrading. Young couples are inclined to have dreams in their heads that make just about anything possible with some enthusiasm and work. They quickly found out they were in over their heads. Right about that time, an older gentleman came into their lives who quickly became their friend. He was an architect by trade, but not only could he draw it, he could actually build it. He taught the young couple about framing, drywalling, plumbing, electrical work, and the most important principle for the do it yourselfer; measure twice cut once. Such a friend was he, that he would drop whatever he was doing in order to help and instruct the couple whenever they had a need or question. He was a timely and faithful friend indeed. God is our architect and friend. He answers us when we call on him with our needs. He instructs and counsels about everything that we encounter, especially when we are in over our heads. Not only did He design us, he knows how to build us. He is worthy of a lifetime of our gratitude.

fields.verse: . . .Sovereign Lord, help me for your name’s sake; out of the goodness of your love, deliver me. For I am poor and needy, and my heart is wounded within me. I fade away like an evening shadow; I am shaken off like a locust. My knees give way from fasting; my body is thin and gaunt. I am an object of scorn to my accusers; when they see me, they shake their heads. Help me, Lord my God; save me according to your unfailing love. - Psalms 109:21‭-‬26 (NIV)
fields.content: To those in deep desperation, the needy, the wounded, the forgotten or ignored, whose life has been sucked out, who are wrongfully accused; to you we offer our support, prayers, and encouragement. God has not deserted you. You are in God's queue and your answer is coming. Hold on! He is with you. His answer will come on time, never late. His unfailing love is your comfort; His joy will be your reward.

fields.verse: My heart, O God, is steadfast; I will sing and make music with all my soul. Awake, harp and lyre! I will awaken the dawn. I will praise you, Lord, among the nations; I will sing of you among the peoples. For great is your love, higher than the heavens; your faithfulness reaches to the skies. Be exalted, O God, above the heavens; let your glory be over all the earth. - Psalms 108:1‭-‬5 (NIV)
fields.content: Once the sun starts peeking over the horizon, it doesn't take long for the shadows and silhouettes to disappear. The world around us explodes with color and we listen with our eyes to the song of a new day. God made everything we can see, and beyond. In humility we respond by joining our hearts in singing praise to our Creator. In awe we marvel at the idea that we know our God in the most personal of ways, and we want the world to know Him too. Lord, make our hearts steadfast in telling the world of your wonders and glory.

fields.verse: . . .Yet he took note of their distress when he heard their cry; for their sake he remembered his covenant and out of his great love he relented. - Psalms 106:44‭-‬45 (NIV)
fields.content: The giants and heros of faith are often the most humble in acknowledging their sins and shortcomings. They readily give credit for their successes to the steadfast love of the Lord, His willingness to forgive and give second chances. When our actions betray our convictions, our witness is met with skepticism, and in many cases invalidated outright. However, God who is true to his covenant, gives us every chance to restore our standing and redeem our calling. We must not allow our frailties and failures to define us. In our shame we can turn to the Faithful One who lifts us out of the mire and once again, over again, time and again, sets our feet on a solid Rock.

"Praise the Lord, my soul. Lord my God, you are very great; you are clothed with splendor and majesty." - Psalms 104:1 (NIV)The robes of monarchy are designed to impress. Made of exotic fabrics, adorned with ribbons and precious stones, tailored to a perfect fit, kings and queens are adorned and appear in public. The people respond with awe. Imagine being the first human, waking up for the first time, and seeing the beauty of creation, none of which was man-made. The mountains, valleys, and lush fields are on full display during the day, and the expansive light display of the stars and planets are slowly unveiled as the sun does its slow retreat. The majesty of  the Monarch of the Universe, clothed in all his splendor is there for us to see. We stand and gaze in awe! We are impressed. "Praise the Lord, my soul. Lord my God, you are very great..."

fields.verse: For as high as the heavens are above the earth, so great is his love for those who fear him; as far as the east is from the west, so far has he removed our transgressions from us. - Psalms 103:11‭-‬12 (NIV)
fields.content: Voyager 1 and 2 are satellites that were launched from earth in 1977. They have travelled over 14 billion miles and continue to transmit information back to earth. They are estimated to continue transmitting until 2050 and will be over 25 billion miles away. The transmitting will stop, but the satellites will keep going; such is the nature of space. God's love surpasses the Voyagers limits. Furthermore, if we travel a continuous loop going East, we'll never intersect with the West. The same is true of traveling West. God's forgiveness has placed our sins on an eastern or western trajectory. They will continue their travel and never cross our paths again. Let that sink in today. Enjoy the peace of His love and forgiveness.

fields.verse: But you remain the same, and your years will never end. - Psalms 102:27 (NIV)
fields.content: There is something to be said about the stability of sameness. There is comfort in the predictable. Change is inevitable and sudden change can leave us disoriented, but change is manageable if it is absorbed in the evolution of a finer tuned rhythm. A piece of music may be played in an altered arrangement, a recipe can be tweaked to personal taste, a detour on a trip can lead to a surprising discovery, but the original music, recipe, or itinerary is the comfortable place where we start. Life changes, but God does not. He is the true North to which our life compass is set. There is stability in that sameness.

fields.verse: Let this be written for a future generation, that a people not yet created may praise the Lord... - Psalms 102:18 (NIV)
fields.content: There is a lot of residential construction going on where we live. It is amazing to see the amount of infrastructure that needs to de done to support the homes planned. The integrity of the buildings is dependent on getting the infrastructure done correctly. Most of the time the builders begin with no clue as to who will occupy the edifices. The idea is to build so that those occupying them can enjoy living in a sturdy, safe building. God is the Architect and Builder. His Word is the infrastructure. What he builds will inspire future generations to marvel at his workmanship.

fields.verse: Your throne was established long ago; you are from all eternity. - Psalms 93:2 (NIV)
fields.content: Eternity works in both directions; our existence however, is measured in time. We have a beginning and an end, but before we were, He was. God created time, a parenthesis in eternity where his creation would dwell. He divided the space with a great light to rule the day, and a lesser light governing the night. One flows seamlessly into the other. Within those parameters he put a limit to the number of our days that could only be expanded by Divine favor. It is God's pleasure to reveal his sovereignty to us. He invites us to share the experience of eternity. A simple yes, on our part, is all it takes to leap over the constraints of time into the security of eternity future. Say yes.

fields.verse: How great are your works, Lord, how profound your thoughts! - Psalms 92:5 (NIV)
fields.content: A work of art, robotics, skyscrapers, and a mountain range all have one thing in common; they all owe their existence to a creator. Those who are creative see and think differently. Someone asked the great artist and sculptor, Michelangelo, how he was able to sculpt David. His answer; "I looked at the block of stone and chipped away everything that didn't look like David." Those of us who struggle drawing stick figures find it difficult to believe the process is that simple. We stand in awe and wonder. Multiply that thought by infinity, spread it across the universe, and we get a glimpse of our Creator. Take a moment to take that in.

fields.verse: Satisfy us in the morning with your unfailing love, that we may sing for joy and be glad all our days. - Psalms 90:14 (NIV)
fields.content: Develop the habit of seeking God's presence and favor as early as you can in your day. Set aside a consistent time, and create a meaningful place to meditate on the Lord's goodness and love. It will set your heart rejoicing and peace will reign in your soul. When the song of the Lord is soothing your thoughts, a positive plan for your day is crystallizing, and your faith has been confirmed, step out to meet the day. You'll be confident and  prepared for any challenges that come your way.

fields.verse: But you, Lord, are a compassionate and gracious God, slow to anger, abounding in love and faithfulness. - Psalms 86:15 (NIV)
fields.content: How do we describe the Lord our God? Compassionate, gracious, slow to anger, abounding in love, and faithful, are all words packed into just one verse of Scripture. There is more, and our history and experience would fill dozens, if not hundreds, of thick books seeking to adequately describe him. The People of God can attest to their truthfulness and accuracy, yet not a half has been told. Our life and testimony can add a word, sentence, paragraph, or chapter. Who is like our God? There is no one.

fields.verse: Love and faithfulness meet together; righteousness and peace kiss each other. Faithfulness springs forth from the earth, and righteousness looks down from heaven. The Lord will indeed give what is good, and our land will yield its harvest. - Psalms 85:10‭-‬12 (NIV)
fields.content: Perhaps you've heard the old saying: "Life is hard, and then you die." These words were probably written or uttered by a person caught up in the deep despair that life can, at times, thrust upon us. But the People of God have a different perspective. The promises of God are unyieldingly faithful. 🎶His steadfast love never ceases. His mercies never come to an end. They are new every morning. 🎶 Abundant life is here and now, and eternity follows. Life is good...and then we live!

fields.verse: Lord Almighty, blessed is the one who trusts in you. - Psalms 84:12 (NIV)
fields.content: The simplest truths are often the most profound. We search the Scriptures looking for signs of the times, codes, novel truths, or secret interpretations, all the while flying past passages that have become all too familiar.  A quick perusal of our walk of faith will note the bumps, twists and turns, and even calamities that have befallen us along the way; but they all yield to the resounding conclusion that God has been with us faithfully through it all. It is the blessing of hindsight, the stability that buttresses our present, and the basis for optimism for tomorrow. We are blessed, pure and simply stated.

fields.verse: Do not hold against us the sins of past generations; may your mercy come quickly to meet us, for we are in desperate need. Help us, God our Savior, for the glory of your name; deliver us and forgive our sins for your name’s sake. Why should the nations say, “Where is their God?” Before our eyes, make known among the nations that you avenge the outpoured blood of your servants. - Psalms 79:8‭-‬10 (NIV)
fields.content: As a nation goes into decline and the consequences of sin become increasingly evident, the present generation bears the responsibility of looking at its past, finding the point of deflection, and petitioning God for deliverance. God desires to show the world his grace and mercy. He raises up a faithful remnant at every low point of history willing to pray in humble repentance. God responds with forgiveness, relief, and redirection. Arise, Church! Let's be the People of our time to abandon the road of destruction for the path of righteousness.

fields.verse: Yet I am always with you; you hold me by my right hand. You guide me with your counsel, and afterward you will take me into glory. - Psalms 73:23‭-‬24 (NIV)
fields.content: There is no escaping the presence of God. It is inconceivable, to those who are his true followers, that anyone would want to. Who doesn't need guidance? Who doesn't profit from godly counsel? In a hostile world on a crooked path, He takes us by the hand and walks with us. Indeed our relationship with Him is loaded with benefits and the retirement plan is out of this world!

fields.verse: Whom have I in heaven but you? And earth has nothing I desire besides you. My flesh and my heart may fail, but God is the strength of my heart and my portion forever. - Psalms 73:25‭-‬26 (NIV)
fields.content: Our human condition is vexed because we put earthly desires above our hunger for God. We expend our energies in the pursuit, or piling up, of riches and desires. At the end of the day we find ourselves with little that satisfies, and even less time to seek the One who does. The Psalmist got it right. There is nothing on earth that fully satisfies, and only One in heaven who does. Lord, increase our passion for you until it surpasses our desires for anything else.

fields.verse: For he will deliver the needy who cry out, the afflicted who have no one to help. He will take pity on the weak and the needy and save the needy from death. He will rescue them from oppression and violence, for precious is their blood in his sight. - Psalms 72:12‭-‬14 (NIV)
fields.content: Our God is the greatest advocate for the weak, needy, and afflicted. He has impressed on our heart a desire to alleviate the needs of the hurting to show his great love for his creation. We may pool our resources and create systems and programs, but it is the singular, simple, act of kindness, passed from person to person, that make the most impact. Being the hands of God extended to embrace another person, goes beyond binding up physical wounds, clothing the naked, and feeding the hungry; a personal touch heals the soul and extends hope. Whatever we do for the least of his, do it as a demonstration of God's love.

fields.verse: My mouth will tell of your righteous deeds, of your saving acts all day long— though I know not how to relate them all. I will come and proclaim your mighty acts, Sovereign Lord; I will proclaim your righteous deeds, yours alone. - Psalms 71:15‭-‬16 (NIV)
fields.content: When the deeds of God are hard to explain, proclaim them with the words you have, regardless of how deficient they may seem.  All throughout the day he reveals himself, and all day long he gives us something to talk about. His acts speak a language of their own, leaving us speechless, which can be a language of its own. God speaks heart to heart and often makes connections that are understood in spite of, and even beyond, the words we use. Speak up!

"The whole earth is filled with awe at your wonders; where morning dawns, where evening fades, you call forth songs of joy." - Psalms 65:8 (NIV)There are 24 time zones in the world. At any given hour, somewhere in the world, the sun is rising, or it is setting. Every day, without interruption, we are treated to the morning display of God lifting the curtain of darkness and revealing the beauty of his earthly creation, arrayed in living color. At sunset, as the light dims, the outlines of his creation are subdued in shades of gray, but it's the heavens turn to explode in all their glory. Sparks, and clusters of stars attract our attention and inspire us to marvel at their beauty. These displays are God's gift to the entire world; and somewhere in the world, in all time zones, amongst every tribe, tongue, and nation, praise rings out. It's our turn.

fields.verse: You who answer prayer, to you all people will come. - Psalms 65:2 (NIV)
fields.content: We don't call a plumber to fix a roof leak, and we don't go to the hardware store to get a gallon of milk: we'd be wasting our time. If we want our prayers answered, we know where to go. Sometimes our options are limited because our time is precious, or the situation is urgent. We can draw up a plan, strategize, and even execute the plan, but we are not guaranteed results. But go to the Lord first; he specializes in answered prayers. He knows what you need, when you need it, and will marshall the resources of heaven and earth to address it. The invitation is open to all.

fields.verse: On my bed I remember you; I think of you through the watches of the night. Because you are my help, I sing in the shadow of your wings. I cling to you; your right hand upholds me. - Psalms 63:6‭-‬8 (NIV)
fields.content: At the end of the day, the day ends. We retire to our beds and reflect on the activities and decisions that were made during the day. The darkness of the room helps us see past the distractions of our perceptions. Then a song of thanksgiving gently pierces the fragile night. It goes straight to the ears of God as the full realization of how much we needed Him is starkly clear. Songs in the night are amongst the purest, as they are sung to an audience of one.

"I have seen you in the sanctuary and beheld your power and your glory.  Because your love is better than life, my lips will glorify you." - Psalms 63:2‭-‬3 (NIV)Places and spaces are designated and consecrated for a purpose. Some are private memorials, others are public celebrations. These spaces may take the shape of majestic cathedrals, or can be a simple bench alongside a lake or river. They are invitations to inspire us to reflect. The beauty and strength of God is revealed in his love. It is there where God reveals himself. In that sacred space we experience His presence, and our lips spontaneously erupt in praise. Consecrate a space where you can experience the love of God. Go there often. He is there, waiting to show you his glory and power.

fields.verse: You, God, are my God, earnestly I seek you; I thirst for you, my whole being longs for you, in a dry and parched land where there is no water. - Psalms 63:1 (NIV)
fields.content: These words were penned in a desert climate at a time when plumbing was non-existent. Water is hard to come by in an arid land; life or death hangs in the balance on having a source of potable water. When we find ourselves in a dearth of God's presence, search for the Source of living water that replenishes our souls. Do so with the same earnestness water is searched for in a desert. He'll lead us beside still waters to restore our souls. Drink deeply, and let's not forget to fill our water bottles; we'll need it for the next leg of the journey.

fields.verse: But I will sing of your strength, in the morning I will sing of your love; for you are my fortress, my refuge in times of trouble. You are my strength, I sing praise to you; you, God, are my fortress, my God on whom I can rely. - Psalms 59:16‭-‬17 (NIV)
fields.content: Whether our troubles are real or imagined, a new day provides us with the opportunity of a fresh start of faith. If we had the blessing of sleeping soundly, our early morning voices resound with clarity and conviction that we serve a strong God. If we tossed, turned, and fidgeted our way to the sunrise, we are greeted by a faithful God who is a refuge in time of trouble: one on whom we can rely. Go ahead and sing; awaken the dawn! Our praises are justified.

fields.verse: My heart, O God, is steadfast, my heart is steadfast; I will sing and make music. Awake, my soul! Awake, harp and lyre! I will awaken the dawn. - Psalms 57:7‭-‬8 (NIV)
fields.content: There are songs for every occasion; they set or express our state of mind in any given moment. It is why the first song of the day is so important. On the solid ground of a steadfast heart, God supplies the melody and the words; we supply the voice. He provides a song of praise sufficient enough to dispel the darkness and fill our day with light. Sing, for a wondrous day awaits our song.

fields.verse: For what you have done I will always praise you in the presence of your faithful people. And I will hope in your name, for your name is good. - Psalms 52:9 (NIV)
fields.content: God has delivered and we are exhilarated; we respond with spontaneous praise. But the initial response is prone to fade if time is not taken to give attention to the details of how the blessing came to be. When we take time to think about it, we find that the process leading to the blessing was a miracle in itself, giving us yet other reasons for praising our God. Don't be quick to move on to The next petition. Let the praise continue long after a blessing has arrived.

fields.verse: For all can see that the wise die, that the foolish and the senseless also perish, leaving their wealth to others. Their tombs will remain their houses forever, their dwellings for endless generations, though they had named lands after themselves. . .But God will redeem me from the realm of the dead; he will surely take me to himself. - Psalms 49:10‭-‬11‭, ‬15 (NIV)
fields.content: This passage may be a bit of a downer this early in the morning, unless we start with the premise that the gospel is good news. No matter our fame and fortune, or lack thereof, our worth is determined not by what we have, but by who we trust. Enjoy the wealth of life if we can; don't despair if our poverty is limiting. Ultimately look to our Redeemer who has secured a place for us in the beauty and richness of the place where he dwells.

fields.verse: For this God is our God for ever and ever; he will be our guide even to the end. - Psalms 48:14 (NIV)
fields.content: Who is the One who spun the planets into orbit and sprinkled the stars into space? Who made the continents take their shape when the boundaries of the oceans were framed? Who structured the atmosphere to make it possible for life to exist? Who took the elements of the earth and fashioned the human pair in his own image? Who, when sin marred his creation, did not abandon it but instead forged the road to redeem it? Who orchestrates the Plan to assure its completion regardless of the twists and turns that appear on the road of history? He is unique. There is no one like him. This God is our God forever and ever.

fields.verse: He says, “Be still, and know that I am God; I will be exalted among the nations, I will be exalted in the earth.” - Psalms 46:10 (NIV)
fields.content: Be still, when our minds are racing. Stand still, when we're itching to join the fray. Be quiet, when it seems something needs to be said. God's voice is most readily heard when the clamor of life is subdued. The early morning, or the last moments of the day are tailor made for reflection and meditation. Steal away to a quiet place to practice quietness of heart. Be still and we'll know that He is God.

fields.verse: It was not by their sword that they won the land, nor did their arm bring them victory; it was your right hand, your arm, and the light of your face, for you loved them. - Psalms 44:3 (NIV)
fields.content: Great exploits for God require acting on causes greater than we can conquer on our own. When we do this, God gets recognized for the successful outcome. We are not pawns in a cosmic chess game, we are partners in a love story. He leads us into battle to repossess the land which was stolen from us, and secures our rightful place in it. His love compels us and his glory goes before us. The victory is ours because the battle belongs to the Lord.

fields.verse: We have heard it with our ears, O God; our ancestors have told us what you did in their days, in days long ago. - Psalms 44:1 (NIV)
fields.content: Each generation has a unique perspective on God, collectively revealing a more complete picture of who he is and what he has done. Sit a spell with old faithful saints. Listen to their stories of how God revealed Himself during their lifetimes. Ask them what stories were passed on to them from previous generations of the faithful. Share what you have learned, and the insights you have gleaned from your own life, with those who will survive you. They'll be richer for it and their faith will be stronger. Pay it forward.

fields.verse: Why, my soul, are you downcast? Why so disturbed within me? Put your hope in God, for I will yet praise him, my Savior and my God. - Psalms 42:5 (NIV)
fields.content: While a few may claim they have never had a bad day, all of us have had occasional bad moments. In fact, some seem prone to attract bad news, and others reap the consequences of bad decisions. Pits are part of the cherry eating experience. When misery is a mystery, our response is clear; we put our hope in God. We refuse to let the darkness of life cause us to lose the light of our faith. He is always there to be Savior and God

fields.verse: Many, Lord my God, are the wonders you have done, the things you planned for us. None can compare with you; were I to speak and tell of your deeds, they would be too many to declare. - Psalms 40:5 (NIV)
fields.content: When wonder becomes reality, we find ourselves at a loss for words. Wonder is not spontaneous, as we might be tempted to think, it is meticulously fashioned by the One who has unlimited creativity. When He reveals his work we are often stunned, dumbstruck, until our minds absorb it; then we can't stop talking about it, until we run out of words. Multiply his wonders by our words and we'll run out of words before He runs out of wonders.

fields.verse: Lord, I wait for you; you will answer, Lord my God. - Psalms 38:15 (NIV)
fields.content: We don't like to wait. We are a people who want everything done in a microwave minute. Standing in line, or sitting in a doctor's waiting room, seems to us to be a colossal waste of time. The best way to wait is to stay busy. Time flies when we're occupied. God will answer; he will come through as promised. In the meantime, go do something else. He'll call you when he's ready

fields.verse: The Lord makes firm the steps of the one who delights in him;  though he may stumble, he will not fall, for the Lord upholds him with his hand. - Psalms 37:23‭-‬24 (NIV)
fields.content: In the days before paved streets and concrete sidewalks, a walking stick was an important commodity. It assured the walker of a measure of confidence when walking on rocky, uneven terrain. When the feet slipped, the stick would be there to catch or steady the traveler. Life is filled with hazards and uneven ground. Seasoned walkers know the value of possessing a good stick. Stick with the Lord. It'll make for a safer, enjoyable walk.

fields.verse: I will give you thanks in the great assembly; among the throngs I will praise you. - Psalms 35:18 (NIV)
fields.content: Parents will tell you that in the midst of a crowd, they can pick up and separate the solitary unique sound of their child. It goes beyond the decibels; it is tuned to the frequency of the heart. They can recognize if it is a cry of joy or despair, and they respond accordingly. God's abilities are beyond understanding. In the midst of the worshipping throng, he is able to fix his attention on each individual voice. Although  gathered in a collective of praise great in number, He knows each of our names, our thoughts, and can pick out your voice in a crowd..

fields.verse: The righteous person may have many troubles, but the Lord delivers him from them all... - Psalms 34:19 (NIV)
fields.content: Believing and doing what is right are good deterrents to warding off many of the bad things that can happen in life, but they don't make us immune to trouble. Sometimes bad things happen to good people. God has offered to walk alongside us to guide and provide interventions for the inevitable problems that come. Don't walk alone.

fields.verse: Those who look to him are radiant; their faces are never covered with shame. - Psalms 34:5 (NIV)
fields.content: The early morning and late evening sun cast the longest shadows. It is when the sun is at its peak that the shadows disappear. Welcome the light at the beginning of the day for it has the brightness of promise. As the day wanes, look to the light and reflect on what good the day has brought. As the sun dips under the horizon, it has not lost it's shine; it is simply displaying Its splendor to another part of the world awaiting the fulfillment of His promise. Those who look to him are radiant. Arise, shine, for your shame has been taken away, your Light has come. 1/7/2022Today's devotional in a nutshell:"This poor man called, and the Lord heard him; he saved him out of all his troubles." - Psalms 34:6 (NIV)Two-thirds of the world's population lives in poverty. Poverty is crippling. But no poverty is worse than poverty of spirit. The loss of hope, and the depth of despair, are the twin maladies of spiritual insecurity. But poverty can serve a beneficial purpose. It is often in our need where we find ourselves seeking for help outside of our exhausted abilities. When we seek, we will find that God is there. When we're out of choices call out and He will hear. Better yet, call out before the options run out!

fields.verse: The angel of the Lord encamps around those who fear him, and he delivers them.  Taste and see that the Lord is good; blessed is the one who takes refuge in him.  Fear the Lord , you his holy people, for those who fear him lack nothing. - Psalms 34:7‭-‬9 (NIV)
fields.content: In a partition of the universe that can only be seen by eyes of faith, the array of God's angels dwell. They have been commissioned with the task of protecting those who love and fear the Lord. One day, when we stand before God in the place where faith is reality, the reel of our lives will be played and we will see how often we needed intervention. In the meantime we can walk through the valley of the shadow of death without fear.

fields.verse: The Lord foils the plans of the nations; he thwarts the purposes of the peoples. But the plans of the Lord stand firm forever, the purposes of his heart through all generations. - Psalms 33:10‭-‬11 (NIV)
fields.content: History has recorded the certainty that all empires eventually fail. Any nation that lives apart from God is destined to fall. But a golden thread is weaved into the fabric of history. It accents and complements the patterns of time making the mundane cloth of human failure fit to be used to make the robes of a King. Although subtle, the plans of the Lord are discernible; they will ultimately succeed in overcoming our penchant for self-destruction. He will not be denied his place in the annals of eternity. Our God reigns!

fields.verse: Sing joyfully to the Lord, you righteous; it is fitting for the upright to praise him. - Psalms 33:1 (NIV)
fields.content: Regardless of the situation and circumstances, take the time to praise God. When things are going smoothly, it's because He is paving the way. When they seem to be falling apart, He's in the background working on holding it all together, or rebuilding the ruins. Praise is always on our agenda. That's why it's always a good day to worship and praise. Doing the right thing, is always the right thing to do.

fields.verse: From heaven the Lord looks down and sees all mankind;  from his dwelling place he watches all who live on earth—  he who forms the hearts of all, who considers everything they do. - Psalms 33:13‭-‬15 (NIV)
fields.content: He is watching. For some that is a fearful thing. To others it is encouraging. Our response depends on our perspective of what his purpose is for watching. If our dominant thought is that God is looking for an opportunity to exact judgement, then we are right to tremble in our boots. If we believe he is looking for opportunities to lead and guide us into righteousness, then we need not fear him. Begin with the premise that God is good. He is watching over you for your own good. That's good!1/2/022This morning's devotional in a nutshell:"Turn your ear to me, come quickly to my rescue; be my rock of refuge, a strong fortress to save me. Since you are my rock and my fortress, for the sake of your name lead and guide me." - Psalms 31:2‭-‬3 (NIV)Most of us have experienced some kind of trouble in our lives. If we haven't, our turn will come soon enough. How we weather the storm often reveals where our faith is. God has staked his name on our rescue and protection. Standing behind the Rock and abiding in his fortress, we are secure. During our time of trouble, look for his guidance and follow his lead.

fields.verse: Therefore, if anyone is in Christ, the new creation has come: The old has gone, the new is here! - 2 Corinthians 5:17 (NIV)
fields.content: Hello 2022! Goodbye 2021. It was a mixed bag. Some good things happened and others, not so good. Today we start a new year with a sense of optimism. It looks promising. However, the coming of Jesus heralded the news that the status quo has been challenged; things going forward would be different; the trajectory of our lives would be corrected and we'd be put back on the right track leading to eternity. Unlike the pursuit of New Year's resolutions, the power of the Gospel does more than help us turn over a new leaf, it gives us the ability to live a new life. Choose Jesus, choose life.

". . .and he went and lived in a town called Nazareth. So was fulfilled what was said through the prophets, that he would be called a Nazarene." - Matthew 2:23 (NIV)It was a case of mistaken identity. Where you live sometimes obscures who you are. Being raised in Nazareth in the home of a humble carpenter, Jesus was called a Nazarene, but his true identity came from where he was born. Bethlehem, the city of David, on the outskirts of Jerusalem, was the place of Jesus' birth. He was of royal lineage. Although you may be typecast for being raised in Chicago, New York, LA, or Miami, you are not the product of where you came from. Once you've been born again, your true roots are revealed. You also are royalty. As a child of the King, you are a part of the family of God.

fields.verse: The people were waiting expectantly and were all wondering in their hearts if John might possibly be the Messiah. John answered them all, “I baptize you with water. But one who is more powerful than I will come, the straps of whose sandals I am not worthy to untie. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and fire. - Luke 3:15‭-‬16 (NIV)
fields.content: Every child is born with potential, but only a handful will rise to the tops of their careers or professions. Along the spectrum there are those who contribute to the development and success of others. They are mentors, teachers, placeholders, preparers for the ones who are to come who will make the biggest difference. There is only one Jesus, Savior of the world, and John the Baptizer had the privilege of announcing his coming. When we see our ultimate goal seemingly fading away, look around. There is probably another lap to run in the relay race of history and our role is to successfully pass the baton to the one who will finish and win. It is a privilege that is reserved for the few; and what a privilege it is!

fields.verse: As it is written in the book of the words of Isaiah the prophet: “A voice of one calling in the wilderness, ‘Prepare the way for the Lord, make straight paths for him. . .And all people will see God’s salvation.’ ”  Luke 3:4‭-‬6 (NIV)
fields.content: We'd be hard pressed to find an incident recorded in the Bible, when God showed up spontaneously unannounced. Our God is a meticulous planner. The signs of what he is doing are all around us, if we take the time to discern. John the Baptizer, who was foretold by Isaiah the prophet hundreds of years before, stepped up to his destiny when his name was called. He prepared the way for Jesus. Even now, the arrangements of our role in the Story are taking place. Be prepared to take your place. The opportunity of a lifetime must be taken in the lifetime of the opportunity.

fields.verse: Every year Jesus’ parents went to Jerusalem for the Festival of the Passover. When he was twelve years old, they went up to the festival, according to the custom. . .And Jesus grew in wisdom and stature, and in favor with God and man. - Luke 2:41‭-‬42‭, ‬52 (NIV)
fields.content: The fanfare of his birth had subsided. The gap in the historical/Scriptural record is over 10 years before we catch a glimpse of what is happening in Jesus' life. What happened during that parenthetical period? The next scene in the narrative is of Jesus debating with the elders in the Temple courts; he is a mere 12 year old. Everyone who heard him was amazed at his understanding. Joseph and Mary had faithfully discharged their privilege and duty. Thus we get to observe the quiet witness of godly parents.

fields.verse: After Jesus was born in Bethlehem in Judea, during the time of King Herod, Magi from the east came to Jerusalem and asked, “Where is the one who has been born king of the Jews? We saw his star when it rose and have come to worship him.”. . .On coming to the house, they saw the child with his mother Mary, and they bowed down and worshiped him. Then they opened their treasures and presented him with gifts of gold, frankincense and myrrh. - Matthew 2:1‭-‬2‭, ‬11 (NIV)
fields.content: It didn't take long for the one born as King of the Jews to be recognized as being distinctively different. Wise men studied the stars and times, looking for Him who was prophesied to come to rescue the world. He would not have to raise up an army to conquer distant lands, the nations would come to him to pay homage. He would be no ordinary king. When the Kings of the East found him they did what we would expect them to do; they bowed in reverence, presented gifts, and worshipped Him. They offered fitting tribute for who he was, the King of kings.

fields.verse: When Joseph and Mary had done everything required by the Law of the Lord, they returned to Galilee to their own town of Nazareth. And the child grew and became strong; he was filled with wisdom, and the grace of God was on him. - Luke 2:39‭-‬40 (NIV)
fields.content: The supporting cast of prophets, angels, and shepherds accomplished their tasks. The King was born as promised, but he was a mere baby, innocent, helpless, and totally dependent. The fulfillment of the promises of God cannot be hurried. After centuries of waiting, the redemption of creation would have to patiently wait for yet another season. The initial rush of adrenaline at the start of God's intervention is often meant to heighten the faith that will be needed as the rest of the answer unfolds. So it's back to Nazareth. The pace slows, but the journey has begun. There is no turning back. God is on a mission to redeem us, and he won't be denied.

fields.verse: The people walking in darkness have seen a great light; on those living in the land of deep darkness a light has dawned. . .For to us a child is born, to us a son is given, and the government will be on his shoulders. And he will be called Wonderful Counselor, Mighty God, Everlasting Father, Prince of Peace. - Isaiah 9:2‭, ‬6 (NIV)
fields.content: In the Garden, when the first act of disobedience occurred, darkness descended on the earth and all its inhabitants.The darkness was only interrupted by the thin rays of hope of a promised redeemer. In an unassuming stable, a baby lay in a manger. His birth was announced by an angelic host, and echoed by simple shepherds in the fields.  His heavenly Father would provide the wisdom for his upbringing, his earthly parents would obediently carry out the instructions. The baby would grow up to be the King of the eternal kingdom. Rejoice, the Day has arrived.

fields.verse: While they were there, the time came for the baby to be born. . . Luke 2:6 (NIV)
fields.content: God orchestrates his plan in precise places and perfect times. No place is too insignificant, no time is too early, or too late. Anything that is considered an obstacle is swept away. No circumstance is devoid of opportunity. There is no better time than God time. After decades and centuries, everything was in order; Jesus would make his appearance, Redemption would be revealed. It was time. . .the fullness of time.

fields.verse: In those days Caesar Augustus issued a decree that a census should be taken of the entire Roman world. . .And everyone went to their own town to register. So Joseph also went up from the town of Nazareth in Galilee to Judea, to Bethlehem the town of David, because he belonged to the house and line of David. He went there to register with Mary, who was pledged to be married to him and was expecting a child. While they were there, the time came for the baby to be born. . . - Luke 2:1‭-‬6 (NIV)
fields.content: An arduous trip was taken during the most sensitive time of pregnancy, just to be properly counted in a census, fulfilled his prophetic destiny. He would live in Nazareth, but his roots were in Bethlehem. His life would be that of a carpenter, but his lineage was firmly esconsed in royalty. He was raised as the son of Joseph, but he would later be recognized as the son of David and rise again as the Son of God. ". . .when the fulness of the time was come, God sent forth his Son..."

fields.verse: The virgin will conceive and give birth to a son, and they will call him Immanuel” (which means “God with us”). - Matthew 1:23 (NIV)
fields.content: God has always been with his people. He was there as a Creator, Sustainer, Guide, Leader, and Deliverer, but never before as he was about to reveal. This time, it would be different. He who was impossible to define became flesh, bone, and blood and made his home with us. He was infinitely holy but came in order to identify with his fallen, marred, unholy, people. At the appropriate time he would do the unthinkable, the unimaginable; he would take our place as the object of His judgment and declare us redeemed. Until then, He was with us; He was one of us. Celebrate the Incarnation.

fields.verse: Because Joseph her husband was faithful to the law, and yet did not want to expose her to public disgrace, he had in mind to divorce her quietly.  But after he had considered this, an angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream and said, “Joseph son of David, do not be afraid to take Mary home as your wife, because what is conceived in her is from the Holy Spirit. She will give birth to a son, and you are to give him the name Jesus, because he will save his people from their sins. . .When Joseph woke up, he did what the angel of the Lord had commanded him and took Mary home as his wife.” - Matthew 1:19‭-‬21,24 (NIV)
fields.content: Imagine the conversation between Joseph and Mary:Mary: "Joseph, I was visited by an angel and he told me I was pregnant with child conceived by the Holy Spirit. Do you believe me?"  Joseph: "No one would believe you, but I too was visited by the angel and he proclaimed to me that what is conceived in you is He who will save us from our sins. I believe you, and I will stand with you."And Joseph did what a righteous man would do, he stepped out in faith and was used as an instrument of God. Be like Joseph.

fields.verse: This is how the birth of Jesus the Messiah came about : His mother Mary was pledged to be married to Joseph, but before they came together, she was found to be pregnant through the Holy Spirit. - Matthew 1:18 (NIV)
fields.content: It wasn't the first time God created something out of nothing. We have the whole of Creation to see how God excels in the miraculous. He had even gathered the dirt he made, formed it into the shape of a man, breathed life into his nostrils, and it became a living being. But this time it was different. He bypassed the law of reproduction inherent in all his creation to form a child without the aid of a man. It was an intersection of the human and divine, an immaculate conception, the progeny of a pure and holy lineage. The Eternal Seed who was promised to be the Redeemer had his beginning in human history. The countdown to the end of sin and death had begun.

fields.verse: “I am the Lord’s servant,” Mary answered. “May your word to me be fulfilled.” Then the angel left her. - Luke 1:38 (NIV)
fields.content: Having just experienced a heavenly visitation and an Archangel delivering a message to her that she would be the bearer of the long awaited Messiah, Mary humbly, and by faith, accepts her calling. The angel leaves and she is alone. She is alone to ponder the ramifications, possibilities, and even consequences of being obedient to God. So young and yet her youth worked to her advantage, for it is most often the young who are fearless and willing to take on even the biggest challenges. And what a challenge it was...to nurture the very Son of God.

fields.verse: But the angel said to her, “Do not be afraid, Mary; you have found favor with God. You will conceive and give birth to a son, and you are to call him Jesus. - Luke 1:30‭-‬31 (NIV)
fields.content: As he walked the hall leading to the throne room of the Majestic One, Gabriel the Archangel rehearsed his history. Chosen from the ranks of the holy messengers, it was his turn, his time, to do what he had trained eons to do. He knelt before the King and heard the words. "The fullness of time has arrived. Go to to the tiny, dusty village of Nazareth and announce to the chosen young lady that redemption will come from her womb. She won't immediately understand, but she'll have enough  time to ponder." So Gabriel went...and now we wait.

fields.verse: How abundant are the good things that you have stored up for those who fear you, that you bestow in the sight of all, on those who take refuge in you. - Psalms 31:19 (NIV)
fields.content: The blessings of God poured out on believers is no secret; it is plain for all to see. It begins with the forgiveness of sin so that we can have a clean start in our relationship with God, in tandem with the promise and hope of eternal life. Oh, but there's more! A Companion and Comforter is part of the treasure trove we are endowed with. Add to that righteousness peace, joy, healing, armor for the battles ahead, and the fruit of the Spirit enabling us to be a blessing to others. There is no downside to serving the Lord. His storehouse is ample adequate, and abundant for everything we encounter. Life is good, because God is good.

fields.verse: I will be glad and rejoice in your love, for you saw my affliction and knew the anguish of my soul. You have not given me into the hands of the enemy but have set my feet in a spacious place. - Psalms 31:7‭-‬8 (NIV)
fields.content: It is God who takes the initiative to come to us in times of distress. Long before we call on him, he sets the wheels of our redemption and deliverance in motion. Our enemies gloat in the delusion of our failure; our future may for a time seem bleak or uncertain, but our rescue is assured. Rejoice and be glad! We will once again dwell in a safe pasture with the Lord as our Shepherd.

fields.verse: Lord, I love the house where you live, the place where your glory dwells. - Psalms 26:8 (NIV)
fields.content: It's been described with words that sound too good to be true; its splendor and majesty are difficult to imagine. A house that is a comfort and joy to live in reflects the tastes, personality, and character of its chief resident. God's glory adorns and radiates from His dwelling. It's a beautiful place, and we have an invitation to visit, to linger, to live with him in his house, forever. Soon, very soon, we are going to see the King.

fields.verse: Surely your goodness and love will follow me all the days of my life, and I will dwell in the house of the Lord forever. - Psalms 23:6 (NIV)
fields.content: When the Lord is our shepherd, we lack nothing. We walk the road of life with confidence even though we know there will be steep and rocky times. His goodness and love follow us like a gentle wind fills a sail: to prod and motivate, or to console and encourage. We never walk alone as he leads us safely to our forever home.

fields.verse: All the ends of the earth will remember and turn to the Lord, and all the families of the nations will bow down before him, for dominion belongs to the Lord and he rules over the nations. - Psalms 22:27‭-‬28 (NIV)
fields.content: The light of the gospel has shined brightly and dimmed to being almost imperceptible in countries and individuals throughout history. Nations and peoples have prospered when holiness and righteousness rule the day. Where the light has dimmed, chaos and despair increases. But the day is coming when all the nations will experience a great revival. We will remember who it is who reigns, and we will bow down to the King. Our day is coming because His day is coming.

fields.verse: Yet you brought me out of the womb; you made me trust in you, even at my mother’s breast. From birth I was cast on you; from my mother’s womb you have been my God. - Psalms 22:9‭-‬10 (NIV)
fields.content: As long as there is breath there is always the hope a prodigal will return home. It will be a great day for feasting. But there is no greater testimony than that of the those who have known the Lord their entire lives and have no knowledge of a day away from God's loving care. Their feast has never known a pause.

fields.verse: In you our ancestors put their trust; they trusted and you delivered them. To you they cried out and were saved; in you they trusted and were not put to shame. - Psalms 22:4‭-‬5 (NIV)
fields.content: What a blessing it is to search our ancestral lines and discover a solid testimony of faith extending back for generations. Such a heritage inspires those in the present and future to trust and serve the Lord. We may expend our energies to leave an inheritance, a name, or a record of philanthropy, but all pale in comparison to leaving a legacy of holiness, righteousness, and faithfulness to the living God. May our family trees be filled with branches bearing abundant fruit.

fields.verse: My God, my God, why have you forsaken me? Why are you so far from saving me, so far from my cries of anguish? My God, I cry out by day, but you do not answer, by night, but I find no rest. Yet you are enthroned as the Holy One; you are the one Israel praises. - Psalms 22:1‭-‬3 (NIV)
fields.content: Testings and trials sometimes seem like they take forever. In the midst of the struggle we may be tempted to think God has turned his back on us. But, we pray by faith anyway. Deep down we know God is on the throne whether we perceive it or not. Hang on! The testing and trial will eventually end. Persevere in prayer and praise;  the answer is on the way.

fields.verse: Some trust in chariots and some in horses, but we trust in the name of the Lord our God. - Psalms 20:7 (NIV)
fields.content: A carefully constructed safety net provides us with a sense of peace and security, but we know that our plans can be interrupted without notice when we least expect it. The Lord provides us with an impenetrable line of defense. Trusting in the Lord must be superimposed over all our attempts to be secure. It is in His Name we find our confidence, our safety, our security.

fields.verse: May these words of my mouth and this meditation of my heart be pleasing in your sight, Lord, my Rock and my Redeemer. - Psalms 19:14 (NIV)
fields.content: Idle thoughts and words can be stumbling blocks to our relational intimacy. Before we speak, let's examine what and how we think. Remember, regardless of who we are speaking to, God is in the audience. May he be pleased with the abundance of the heart our words convey.

fields.verse: But who can discern their own errors? Forgive my hidden faults. - Psalms 19:12 (NIV)
fields.content: We are often blind to our own shortcomings. Sometimes our actions, or the thoughts that enter into our heads, surprise and/or embarrass us. Good friends can be objective and lovingly point out our weaknesses and duplicity, while extending to us understanding and a path to redemption. We have such a friend in our Lord. Let that which is hidden be revealed and resolved. He knows the thoughts and intents of our hearts and leads us in a path of righteousness.

fields.verse: You, Lord, keep my lamp burning; my God turns my darkness into light. - Psalms 18:28 (NIV)
fields.content: He provides the fuel, trims the wick, and positions the lamp in the place where it can give the most light. The people of God are the light of the world. Dispel the darkness! Let your light shine.

fields.verse: As for God, his way is perfect: The Lord’s word is flawless; he shields all who take refuge in him. For who is God besides the Lord? And who is the Rock except our God? - Psalms 18:30‭-‬31 (NIV)
fields.content: There is no one like him; none who can compare. He is a shelter in a time of storm and welcomes all who desire a shield of protection. He is our Rock; unshakeable, immovable, a sure foundation. We can confidently trust him because he has given us his word. His word is perfect. There is no one like him.

fields.verse: As for me, I will be vindicated and will see your face; when I awake, I will be satisfied with seeing your likeness. - Psalms 17:15 (NIV)
fields.content: At the end of the day, the day ends. Our attempts at living for God, our victories and shortcomings, will all be filed away in the annals of our history. A day dedicated to seeking, loving, and serving the Lord is a good investment. God is pleased. We sleep, because we need rest to be prepared for another day. God watches over us as we slumber, and is there to greet us again when the sun rises. He says to us, "Good morning! It's going to be a good day." At the beginning of the day, the day begins.

fields.verse: Keep me as the apple of your eye; hide me in the shadow of your wings. - Psalms 17:8 (NIV)
fields.content: We are not supposed to favor our children one above the other, but each of our children is our favorite in different ways. God's children come in different sizes, shapes, colors, and personality. He loves us all uniquely and completely. He has a special place under his wings for each of us. God has big wings.

fields.verse: Show me the wonders of your great love, you who save by your right hand those who take refuge in you from their foes. - Psalms 17:7 (NIV)
fields.content: Wonder; a feeling of surprise mingled with admiration, caused by something beautiful, unexpected, unfamiliar, or inexplicable. (The Oxford Dictionary) As beautiful as that definition is, it probably falls short of revealing the fullness of God and his ways. Let's not allow ourselves to be comfortable with our understanding of God, for he has layers of beauty and awesomeness that will take more than a lifetime to discover.

fields.verse: You make known to me the path of life; you will fill me with joy in your presence, with eternal pleasures at your right hand. - Psalms 16:11 (NIV)
fields.content: There may be some hesitancy at the start of a trip, but there can be joy in the journey and the certainty of a reward awaiting at the destination. It helps to have the companionship of Someone who has been there before. He gives us confidence with each step we take. Go for a walk today. Put your hand in the hand of the One who knows the way. Jesus, lead on!

fields.verse: But I trust in your unfailing love; my heart rejoices in your salvation. I will sing the Lord ’s praise, for he has been good to me. - Psalms 13:5‭-‬6 (NIV)
fields.content: The psalmist begins by bemoaning his condition, (vss 1-4) wondering if it will be his final fate. He articulates his sorrowful response to his enemy's attack and God's seemingly lack of attention. But (there's that word) he adds a disclaimer, an exception, a default to his circumstances. His go to is that God has been unfailing in his love in the past; singing and rejoicing are in order. It is always to our advantage to begin with the premise, or come to the conclusion, that God is good.

fields.verse: And the words of the Lord are flawless, like silver purified in a crucible, like gold refined seven times. - Psalms 12:6 (NIV)
fields.content: We are the heirs of a massive treasure chest. It overflows with flawless gems and the purest of gold and silver. God's words reveal the riches of his mind, heart, and plans. Nuggets of knowledge, pearls of wisdom, gems of truth, he freely provides. His words are the currency of a rich and abundant life. We are wealthy beyond belief...believe it.

fields.verse: Why, Lord, do you stand far off? Why do you hide yourself in times of trouble? - Psalms 10:1 (NIV)
fields.content: At times he seems far off. Our prayers bounce off the ceiling and fall to the ground with a thud. Has he broken his promise that he would never leave us? These are the times when our faith is tried. We continue to pray and trust, not because our prayers are answered, but because faithful is the One who has made the promise. Hang on. His timing is impeccable. The answer is sure to come.

fields.verse: My enemies turn back; they stumble and perish before you.  For you have upheld my right and my cause, sitting enthroned as the righteous judge. - Psalms 9:3‭-‬4 (NIV)
fields.content: Tough criticism, false accusations, and harsh judgement can befall us, but God is our defender and vindicator. He knows the intent of our hearts and upholds us when we are unfairly charged. Stand fast in the faith and knowledge that God is firmly on our side.

fields.verse: When I consider your heavens, the work of your fingers, the moon and the stars, which you have set in place, what is mankind that you are mindful of them, human beings that you care for them? - Psalms 8:3‭-‬4 (NIV)
fields.content: Wait for a clear night, travel to a place where the pollution of manmade light gives way to the natural light of the created order, and be amazed. As your eyes adjust to the darkness, you are treated to layers of stars. Sections of the sky you thought were dark are illuminated by pinpoints of light so numerous they cannot be counted. We are a speck within the created order and yet the God of the universe created us to reign with him. The thought is exhilarating and profoundly humbling. His ways are way above our ways.

fields.verse: I will give thanks to the Lord because of his righteousness; I will sing the praises of the name of the Lord Most High. - Psalms 7:17 (NIV)
fields.content: Today we observe a National Day of Thanksgiving. We offer our thanks to those who have rendered unto us a service, a good deed, an act of kindness, or support. We don't have to look far to find something to be thankful for. Our greatest reason to be thankful is God himself. He has displayed his splendor in his Creation. His lovingkindness is rich and full beyond measure. He gave his best when we were at our worst. He has established righteousness where his holiness is on display. We can give thanks, today and everyday, for there is plenty of reason to do so.

fields.verse: Bring to an end the violence of the wicked and make the righteous secure— you, the righteous God who probes minds and hearts. - Psalms 7:9 (NIV)
fields.content: We may debate the source of evil and wickedness, but it is impossible to deny its existence. We may take all kinds of steps to deter evil, but on this side of the Great Divide it will stubbornly resist. So we do our part to confront the evil of our day while we wait for the Day when God's patience will run its course. In that day He will prove His way is better, and bring to an end the foolishness of the violent and wicked. Righteousness will prevail. Selah.

fields.verse: But let all who take refuge in you be glad; let them ever sing for joy. Spread your protection over them, that those who love your name may rejoice in you. - Psalms 5:11 (NIV)
fields.content: A reading nook, garage work space, or favorite fishing spot,  all have one thing in common; they are places we go to seek rest, comfort, peace, and security. Some call it their happy place. Taking refuge in God's presence is the ultimate happy place. He turns our mourning into dancing and lifts our sorrows. Go there often. Let yourself in, His door is unlocked.

fields.verse: . . . I, by your great love, can come into your house; in reverence I bow down toward your holy temple. - Psalms 5:7 (NIV)
fields.content: Our invitation to meet with God comes, not from social standing, academic accomplishments, or economic advantage, but purely by God's love for, and desire to spend time with us. His dwelling place is a marvel to behold and calls for a reverent response. Give him a visit. He's expecting you. 11/21/2021This morning's devotional in a nutshell:"In the morning, Lord, you hear my voice; in the morning I lay my requests before you and wait expectantly." - Psalms 5:3 (NIV)Before the hustle, bustle, and demands of life sets in, spend time with God. Each morning brings with it promise and potential. Wait expectantly and marvel at how the Lord unveils his plan. He goes before us; all we have to do is follow. Jesus, lead on!

fields.verse: Lord, how many are my foes! How many rise up against me!  Many are saying of me, 'God will not deliver him.' But you, Lord, are a shield around me, my glory, the One who lifts my head high. I call out to the Lord, and he answers me from his holy mountain. - Psalms 3:1‭-‬4 (NIV)
fields.content: Our present day may mirror Edenic innocence, but there is a serpent lurking in the shadows of the Garden. Scoffers may say we are sitting ducks in the cross hairs of a stealthy sniper, but God has formed a shield around us and holds the high ground. In times of trouble, he responds from His holy hill. Keep looking up! That's where our help comes from.

fields.verse: I lie down and sleep; I wake again, because the Lord sustains me. - Psalms 3:5 (NIV)
fields.content: Looking back, he was there. Taking stock, he is here. Looking to the future, he will be there. Rest assured; he sustains. No matter where we've been, no matter where we are, no matter where we're going; we can count on his faithfulness.

fields.verse: “Look, I am coming soon! My reward is with me, and I will give to each person according to what they have done. I am the Alpha and the Omega, the First and the Last, the Beginning and the End. Blessed are those who wash their robes, that they may have the right to the tree of life and may go through the gates into the city. - Revelation 22:12‭-‬14 (NIV)
fields.content: The Revelation of John concludes with an invitation to once again eat from the tree of life. You may remember that tree. (Genesis 2:9) It was the source of our nourishment in knowing and understanding God. What is conspicuously absent in the new heaven and earth, is the tree of the knowledge of good and evil. Our entire history has unfolded as the result of eating from that tree in the first Garden. In the new kingdom, there will be no need to gain further understanding of evil. We are all sufficiently knowledgeable as we look back through human history. Now the knowledge of what is good and righteous will be displayed in all its fullness. The Kingdom focus is on the "life and more abundantly" Jesus promised his followers. As we close the chapter on the Book of John's revelation go in peace to love and serve the Lord. Jesus, lead on!

fields.verse: And I heard a loud voice from the throne saying, “Look! God’s dwelling place is now among the people, and he will dwell with them. They will be his people, and God himself will be with them and be their God. ‘He will wipe every tear from their eyes. There will be no more death’ or mourning or crying or pain, for the old order of things has passed away.”  He who was seated on the throne said, “I am making everything new!” Then he said, “Write this down, for these words are trustworthy and true.” - Revelation 21:3‭-‬5 (NIV)
fields.content: Up to this point, the Revelation plays out like a Lord of the Rings movie. In these last two chapters the judgment is complete and the new order of the Kingdom is established. A good ending makes a good story. Revelation has a great ending. God himself establishes his throne amongst his people. The old order of pain, crying, and suffering is replaced with the all encompassing peace of his presence and reign. It marks the end of the curse and the beginning of eternity under God rule. Life as we know it with it's ups and downs, will be replaced by unspeakable, indescribable, uncontainable, joy. It is difficult to describe, but totally true. Hold on! What is coming is more than worth the wait.

fields.verse: Then I heard what sounded like a great multitude, like the roar of rushing waters and like loud peals of thunder, shouting: “Hallelujah! For our Lord God Almighty reigns. Let us rejoice and be glad and give him glory! For the wedding of the Lamb has come, and his bride has made herself ready. Fine linen, bright and clean, was given her to wear.” (Fine linen stands for the righteous acts of God’s holy people.) - Revelation 19:6‭-8 (NIV)
fields.content: After the judgment of God has been poured out on his foes, there will be a great and grand celebration. But it will not be about the victory over God's enemies; it will be a wedding feast celebrating the union of Jesus, the groom, with his Bride, the people of God. She will be presented in clean, fine linen. He will be clothed with radiant holiness. What a glorious feast that will be! This event is what believers long for. It is what Jesus died for. Intimate fellowship will be restored. From every tribe, tongue, and nation, we will dance on golden streets singing the song of the Lamb. :notes: He is worthy of glory, honor and praise forevermore!:notes:

fields.verse: After this I saw another angel coming down from heaven. He had great authority, and the earth was illuminated by his splendor. With a mighty voice he shouted: “ ‘Fallen! Fallen is Babylon the Great!’ . . .For all the nations have drunk the maddening wine of her adulteries. The kings of the earth committed adultery with her, and the merchants of the earth grew rich from her excessive luxuries. . . . Rejoice over her, you heavens! Rejoice, you people of God! Rejoice, apostles and prophets! For God has judged her with the judgment she imposed on you.” - Revelation 18:1-3, 20 (NIV)
fields.content: The corruption and evil of the one world order and economic system will come tumbling down with a loud crash. The oppression against the innocents will be lifted. Freedom will reign. This will be accomplished by the Ruler of the Kingdom who once proclaimed "Who the Son sets free, is free indeed." We need not despair at the illusion that evil seems to be winning or that the earth is irredeemable. A great false god must be rendered a humiliating defeat by the One True God. Our God is more than up for the task. He will reign as he always has, forever and ever!

fields.verse: One of the seven angels who had the seven bowls came and said to me, “Come, I will show you the punishment of the great prostitute, who sits by many waters . . . The name written on her forehead was a mystery: babylon the great the mother of prostitutes and of the abominations of the earth . . . I saw that the woman was drunk with the blood of God’s holy people, the blood of those who bore testimony to Jesus. When I saw her, I was greatly astonished. . . They are also seven kings. Five have fallen, one is, the other has not yet come; but when he does come, he must remain for only a little while . . . “The ten horns you saw are ten kings who have not yet received a kingdom, but who for one hour will receive authority as kings along with the beast. They have one purpose and will give their power and authority to the beast. They will wage war against the Lamb, but the Lamb will triumph over them because he is Lord of Lords and King of kings—and with him will be his called, chosen and faithful followers.” . . . The woman you saw is the great city that rules over the kings of the earth.” - Revelation 17:1‭, ‬5‭-‬6‭, ‬10‭, ‬12‭-‬14‭, ‬18 (NIV)
fields.content: In his vision, John foresees a coming consolidation of world power under a one world leader. This leader will wage war against the people of God. Rebellion against God is lunacy - pride dressed in drunken bravado. It picks a fight with the biggest person in the room and then flails away at a target it can't hit. Don't let the massive, intrusive, capability of the coming world order scare you. God is omnipotent, all powerful; no one can stand against him. Any and all nations who come against God and the expansion of his kingdom are destined to fail. Stand firm. Keep reading. The last battle is about to be fought and the ending is awesome.

fields.verse: Then I heard a loud voice from the temple saying to the seven angels, “Go, pour out the seven bowls of God’s wrath on the earth.” The first angel went and poured out his bowl on the land . . . The seventh angel poured out his bowl into the air, and out of the temple came a loud voice from the throne, saying, “It is done!” - Revelation 16:1‭-‬2‭, ‬17 (NIV)
fields.content: The evil that has caused immeasurable pain in the earth will be dealt with swiftly and completely. God desires to restore his creation to the beauty and splendor of its first week. But first he must cleanse it from the effects of sin and rebellion. Why is it taking so long? It is a testament to God's patience. His coming wrath is withheld while he extends his hand of mercy and grace from generation to generation. Along the way he issues preemptive warnings. Thus, the last seven bowls are reserved for those who have utterly rejected him. But his last word is not in anger and judgment. Keep reading, the best is yet to come.

fields.verse: Then I heard a voice from heaven say, “Write this: Blessed are the dead who die in the Lord from now on.” “Yes,” says the Spirit, “they will rest from their labor, for their deeds will follow them.” - Revelation 14:13 (NIV)
fields.content: "Everyone wants to go to heaven, but nobody wants to die." Death is a topic we'd rather avoid. In fact, we use euphemisms like: passed away, expired, and departed, to soften the impact. John's vision describes a coming time of geopolitical struggle, famine, disease, economic tumult, and brutal dictatorship that makes the prospect of escape, and even death, a welcomed option. Believers are not immune from the problems of the world. This is why we rest our hopes on God's promise that all things will eventually be resolved either in this life or the life to come. As Paul the Apostle has said; "To live is Christ; to die is gain." Fear not! Our present may be uneventful, it may change and get difficult, but our future is secure. Because we have God's promise, death is not the worst thing that can happen to a believer.

fields.verse: When the dragon saw that he had been hurled to the earth, he pursued the woman who had given birth to the male child. The woman was given the two wings of a great eagle, so that she might fly to the place prepared for her in the wilderness, where she would be taken care of for a time, times and half a time, out of the serpent’s reach . . . Then the dragon was enraged at the woman and went off to wage war against the rest of her offspring—those who keep God’s commands and hold fast their testimony about Jesus. - Revelation 12:13‭-‬14‭, ‬17 (NIV)
fields.content: In highly symbolic language, John describes how after being kicked out of God's presence, the dragon (Satan) levels his anger and wrath toward the woman's offspring (the Church). Throughout history, the people of God have been in stages of preparing for, living in, and surviving, persecution. Jesus said that all who live godly in him will suffer persecution. It is not to be sought, but should be expected. Even as the enemy is persistent, the people of God are called to persevere. Do not be discouraged. Though the enemy rages, keep fighting! His days are numbered. Keep reading, the people of God will win.

fields.verse: Then war broke out in heaven. Michael and his angels fought against the dragon, and the dragon and his angels fought back. But he was not strong enough, and they lost their place in heaven. The great dragon was hurled down—that ancient serpent called the devil, or Satan, who leads the whole world astray. He was hurled to the earth, and his angels with him. - Revelation 12:7‭-‬9 (NIV)
fields.content: The arrogance of the enemy knows no bounds. In his desire to claim sovereignty over God's kingdom, he mounted an offense in heaven itself. But he was summarily repelled and cast out of heaven where hFe has been trying to salve his wounds by making war against the people of God. But God is not finished in the humiliation of the fallen angel and his cohort. The earth becomes the focus of the cosmic battle. Satan's defeat is coming in every place for all time. The gates of hell will not prevail, and the fullness of the Kingdom will soon be revealed. Hold on and read on! Sometimes it gets messy, but the outcome is never in doubt. Salvation belongs to our God, who sits on the throne!

fields.verse: And I saw the seven angels who stand before God, and seven trumpets were given to them. Another angel, who had a golden censer, came and stood at the altar. He was given much incense to offer, with the prayers of all God’s people, on the golden altar in front of the throne. The smoke of the incense, together with the prayers of God’s people, went up before God from the angel’s hand. Then the angel took the censer, filled it with fire from the altar, and hurled it on the earth; and there came peals of thunder, rumblings, flashes of lightning and an earthquake. . .the first angel sounded his trumpet. . .The seventh angel sounded his trumpet, and there were loud voices in heaven, which said: “The kingdom of the world has become the kingdom of our Lord and of his Messiah, and he will reign for ever and ever.” - Revelation 8:2-5, 7; 11:15 (NIV)
fields.content: As devastating as the contents of this section of Revelation portrays, the first six trumpet blasts are an actual answer to prayer for justice by the people of God. The time is coming when evil will be eliminated. Justice for the innocents entails imposing judgment on the guilty. In order for us to experience the peace and joy of the kingdom, righteousness must be established. Until that day, our prayers will rise and be mingled with the incense of praise and the first of seven trumpets will sound. Keep looking up!

fields.verse: I watched as the Lamb opened the first of the seven seals. Then I heard one of the four living creatures say in a voice like thunder, “Come!” . . .  When he opened the seventh seal, there was silence in heaven for about half an hour. - Revelation 6:1‭-8:1 (NIV)
fields.content: John watched in amazement as seven seals were opened in rapid succession. It's hard to tell what they all mean, but the first five seals involve the tumult and the chaos of war, faltering economies, famines, plagues, martyrdom, and worldwide natural disasters. The sixth seal unveils the redeemed of Israel and of the faithful peoples, tribes, and nations, who have survived the calamity of the times. The scene is so marvelous that the survivors break out in spontaneous, loud, extended praise and adoration, followed by the opening of the seventh seal. Heaven pauses in complete silence, the silence of awe. Picture yourself among the redeemed having survived the perils of life. The Lamb makes it possible.

fields.verse: And they sang a new song, saying: “You are worthy to take the scroll and to open its seals, because you were slain, and with your blood you purchased for God persons from every tribe and language and people and nation. . . I watched as the Lamb opened the first of the seven seals. Then I heard one of the four living creatures say in a voice like thunder, “Come!” - Revelation 5:9, 6:1 (NIV)
fields.content: The unveiling of John's vision gains speed. He who alone is qualified, opens the scroll. In ancient times, a very important letter or document was secured with multiple seals. As each seal was broken, the suspense would increase and anticipation of the contents of the scroll would build. What comes next in the Revelation unfolds with amazing speed, gathering momentum with each succeeding seal that is opened. It is often overwhelming to the mind and causes pauses in the telling of the story. Thus the previous instructions to "those who have ears." We are to cultivate the ability to hear the Spirit's voice; it will be crucial when God's plan is accelerating to completion. Be ready.

fields.verse: Then I heard every creature in heaven and on earth and under the earth and on the sea, and all that is in them, saying: “To him who sits on the throne and to the Lamb be praise and honor and glory and power, for ever and ever!” - Revelation 5:13 (NIV)
fields.content: One day, "every knee will bow and every tongue confess, that Jesus Christ is Lord, to the glory of God the Father." It is inevitable because the human race will eventually run out of answers and acknowledge that our efforts to fix a broken world have fallen short. So we will turn to the Master Architect, the one who planned it all and put it into motion. Some will bow out of reverence. Others will feel the heavy weight of their insufficiency pressing them to their knees. All will bow. And when we do, the beauty of His plan will be unfolded and we will ascribe to him "honor and glory and power, forever and ever."

"And they sang a new song, saying: 'You are worthy to take the scroll and to open its seals, because you were slain, and with your blood you purchased for God persons from every tribe and language and people and nation. You have made them to be a kingdom and priests to serve our God, and they will reign on the earth'." - Revelation 5:9‭-‬10 (NIV)John's vision shifts to an intense scene in the heavenly realms with a lamb at its center. The description of what is happening around the throne identifies the lamb as the Lamb, Jesus. The shed blood of the Lamb purchased the redemption of peoples from every tribe, language, and nation. The Lamb is our common ground. In His presence all labels and distinctions disappear. In their place, he creates a new order, generation, family, and kingdom. He rules and we reign with Him. We are Kingdom citizens, side by side, serving the Creator.

fields.verse: “You are worthy, our Lord and God, to receive glory and honor and power, for you created all things, and by your will they were created and have their being.” - Revelation 4:11 (NIV)
fields.content: John is given a vision of the Almighty seated on His throne. He responds by bowing in reverence and adoration.
