fields.verse: You turned my wailing into dancing; you removed my sackcloth and clothed me with joy, that my heart may sing your praises and not be silent. Lord my God, I will praise you forever. - Psalms 30:11‭-‬12 (NIV)
fields.content: Whether life is marked by a time of peace or the darkness of suffering, in Him we find our joy. Let your hope be manifested in a song, and a big smile of contentment as you put on your dancing shoes.

fields.verse: ...weeping may stay for the night, but rejoicing comes in the morning. Psalms 30:5b (NIV)
fields.content: With every sunrise comes the hope and promise that you are one step closer to overcoming the things that keep you awake at night. Be hopeful.

fields.verse: I remain confident of this: I will see the goodness of the Lord in the land of the living. - Psalms 27:13 (NIV)
fields.content: That to which we refer to as death is actually the continuation of life, but on another plane. God created us to live eternally. It is in on this side of the Great Divide where the determination is made for the quality of life on the other side. Be confident.

fields.verse: Lord, I love the house where you live, the place where your glory dwells. - Psalms 26:8 (NIV)
fields.content: Houses of worship are built in faith as depictions of the space where God dwells. Sometimes they are built by gifted artisans and reflect majesty and splendor. At other times they are simple and humble reminding us of God's connection with the common person. It is the humility of our hearts that makes the space lovely. Enter in; be at peace in his presence.

fields.verse: The Lord is my shepherd, I lack nothing. - Psalms 23:1 (NIV)
fields.content: Much of what we crave is rooted in desire rather than need. Although God often grants many of the desires of our hearts, we can count on him to faithfully attend to our needs. What is your need today?

fields.verse: Posterity will serve him; future generations will be told about the Lord.  They will proclaim his righteousness, declaring to a people yet unborn: He has done it! - Psalms 22:30‭-‬31 (NIV)
fields.content: The light of truth will never be extinguished--not in our day nor the ones to come. Looking back and acknowledging his faithfulness grants us the comfort of looking forward in faith.

fields.verse: In you our ancestors put their trust; they trusted and you delivered them.  To you they cried out and were saved; in you they trusted and were not put to shame. - Psalms 22:4‭-‬5 (NIV)
fields.content: The people of God have a long history of God's existence and involvement. Although each generation must discover him anew, he has proven to be faithful to those who seek him.

fields.verse: My God, my God, why have you forsaken me? Why are you so far from saving me, so far from my cries of anguish?  My God, I cry out by day, but you do not answer, by night, but I find no rest.  Yet you are enthroned as the Holy One;... - Psalms 22:1‭-‬3 (NIV)
fields.content: There are trials that consume us with anguish day and night. They may be so intense that they cause us to question whether God has forsaken us. Faith reminds us he is there beyond the facts. Hold on.

fields.verse: Now this I know: The Lord gives victory to his anointed. He answers him from his heavenly sanctuary with the victorious power of his right hand. Some trust in chariots and some in horses, but we trust in the name of the Lord our God. - Psalms 20:6‭-‬7 (NIV)
fields.content: Our victory is certain as we know for sure that God is behind it. We trust not in the weapons we have gathered or the strategies in our plans. The name of the Lord is sufficient to put the enemy to flight..

fields.verse: I keep my eyes always on the Lord . With him at my right hand, I will not be shaken. - Psalms 16:8 (NIV)
fields.content: It takes a lot of discipline to stay singularly focused. To be successful in all the things that matter requires diligence and perseverance. So It is in our pursuit of the Kingdom of God.

fields.verse: Help, Lord , for no one is faithful anymore; those who are loyal have vanished from the human race. - Psalms 12:1 (NIV)
fields.content: Sometimes it seems that way, doesn't it? But in every generation, the Lord retains for himself a faithful remnant. Count yourself among them. Like hearty wheat growing in defiance of the choking weeds, persevere. God will not be denied his victory.

fields.verse: When the foundations are being destroyed, what can the righteous do?” - Psalms 11:3 (NIV)
fields.content: Stay righteous, of course! Don't follow the crowd. Don't give up, in, or over to the tempter! It is never wrong to be and do what is right.

fields.verse: Lord, our Lord, how majestic is your name in all the earth! Psalms 8:1,9 (NIV)
fields.content: Somewhere this morning someone will be sitting on a beach watching a beautiful sunrise. Somewhere this evening someone will be standing on a deck watching the sun dip and disappear behind the mountains. No matter what happens between dawn and dusk, the Lord starts and ends his day, every day, in glorious splendor.

fields.verse: My shield is God Most High, who saves the upright in heart.  God is a righteous judge, a God who displays his wrath every day. If he does not relent, he will sharpen his sword; he will bend and string his bow. He has prepared his deadly weapons; he makes ready his flaming arrows. - Psalms 7:10‭-‬13 (NIV)
fields.content: In our efforts to convey God's love, we must be reminded that God hates evil. Good and evil are locked in mortal combat; they cannot coexist together forever. Judgement and justice go hand in hand. Righteousness prevails and the righteous will be vindicated. Stay faithful.

fields.verse: But I, by your great love, can come into your house; in reverence I bow down toward your holy temple. - Psalms 5:7 (NIV)
fields.content: It is the love of God that draws us to His presence. While others cower in fear and can't find suitable ways to appease their angry gods, we approach with reverence and confidence knowing He welcomes us.

fields.verse: I lie down and sleep; I wake again, because the Lord sustains me. Psalms 3:5 (NIV)
fields.content: From time to time your body signals you need more sleep than normal. If you can, listen to your body. Sleep allows God to restore you while bypassing the distractions in your life. Sometimes God's will for you is to take a nap.

fields.verse: For the Lord watches over the way of the righteous, but the way of the wicked leads to destruction. Psalms 1:6 (NIV)
fields.content: The road of history has many twists and turns, but at the final destination the battle between good and evil will be eternally resolved. Jesus lead on.

fields.verse: Blessed is the one who does not walk in step with the wicked or stand in the way that sinners take or sit in the company of mockers, but whose delight is in the law of the Lord, and who meditates on his law day and night. That person is like a tree planted by streams of water, which yields its fruit in season and whose leaf does not wither—whatever they do prospers. - Psalms 1:1‭-‬3 (NIV)
fields.content: The company you keep influences the life you live. A good life consists of what we do as well as what we don't do.  A good place to be planted is where we can be nourished by water and word. Fruitfulness can be expected there.

fields.verse: Now the serpent was more crafty than any of the wild animals the Lord God had made. He said to the woman, “Did God really say, ‘You must not eat from any tree in the garden’? - Genesis 3:1‭ (NIV)
fields.content: In the beauty of the garden, temptation lies in wait. Distortion and distraction are the tools the enemy readily uses. Enjoy the beauty of God's work, but be alert for the one who wants to ruin it all.

fields.verse: The Lord God said, “It is not good for the man to be alone. I will make a helper suitable for him.” - Genesis 2:18 (NIV)
fields.content: Male and female, created in his image, provide us with the clearest definition of who God is. We were created with a need for companionship. Suitable, complimentary, and compatible partnership is the gift of God to satisfy our yearning to love, be loved. In that partnership, we are able to exercise good stewardship over that with which we have been entrusted.

fields.verse: By the seventh day God had finished the work he had been doing; so on the seventh day he rested from all his work. Then God blessed the seventh day and made it holy, because on it he rested from all the work of creating that he had done. - Genesis 2:2‭-‬3 (NIV)
fields.content: Creating can be exhilarating...and exhausting. A holy hush settles over a completed labor of love. Set aside some time to take it all in. Resist the impulse of moving on to the next task. Satisfaction over a job well done is a reward.

fields.verse: God saw all that he had made, and it was very good. And there was evening, and there was morning—the sixth day. - Genesis 1:31 (NIV)
fields.content: Everything God creates is good, because God is good. Everything God creates has a purpose. Purpose gives meaning to existence. Live on purpose.

fields.verse: In the beginning God created the heavens and the earth. Now the earth was formless and empty, darkness was over the surface of the deep, and the Spirit of God was hovering over the waters. Genesis 1:1‭-‬2 (NIV)
fields.content: The beginning of creative work often begins with dark, formless, emptiness. Don't despair. The Spirit hovers over the process as we anticipate the Divine spark of light. Even in the darkness, God is at work. Be patient. The finished result will be majestic in splendor.

fields.verse: To him who is able to keep you from stumbling and to present you before his glorious presence without fault and with great joy— to the only God our Savior be glory, majesty, power and authority, through Jesus Christ our Lord, before all ages, now and forevermore! Amen. - Jude 1:24‭-‬25 (NIV)
fields.content: This is a wonderful passage to close the letter. It is often used as a benediction at the conclusion of a church service. But it also shines through in the morning, and can set the pace for the day, as a reminder that we serve a God who saves and sustains.

fields.verse: To him who is able to keep you from stumbling and to present you before his glorious presence without fault and with great joy— to the only God our Savior be glory, majesty, power and authority, through Jesus Christ our Lord, before all ages, now and forevermore! Amen. - Jude 1:24‭-‬25 (NIV)
fields.content: This is a wonderful passage to close the letter. It is often used as a benediction at the conclusion of a church service. But it also shines through in the morning, and can set the pace for the day, as a reminder that we serve a God who will saves and sustains.

fields.verse: I have much to write you, but I do not want to do so with pen and ink. I hope to see you soon, and we will talk face to face. Peace to you. The friends here send their greetings. Greet the friends there by name. - 3 John 1:13‭-‬14 (NIV)
fields.content: Modern technologies provide us with the ability to communicate and build relationships over long distances; but there is much to be said about getting together in person. Take time to stay connected.

fields.verse: This is the confidence we have in approaching God: that if we ask anything according to his will, he hears us. And if we know that he hears us—whatever we ask—we know that we have what we asked of him.
fields.content: It is not with shaking knees and a trembling voice that we approach a temperamental god; it is with the humility and confidence of children, that we enter the presence of a loving Father, to receive our inheritance.

fields.verse: Dear friends, since God so loved us, we also ought to love one another. 1 John 4:11 (NIV)
fields.content: Believers don't have an option on who to love. Think of the person you find to be the most difficult to love. God loves them. Ask God to teach you how to love them the way he loves them.

fields.verse: This is how God showed his love among us: He sent his one and only Son into the world that we might live through him. This is love: not that we loved God, but that he loved us and sent his Son as an atoning sacrifice for our sins.
fields.content: The question this morning is; Which politician gave his life to secure your salvation? Which professor, doctor, historian, or newscaster? There is no other name by which we can be saved. Jesus is the one who will correct all wrongs and restore righteousness, peace, and justice.

fields.verse: You, dear children, are from God and have overcome them, because the one who is in you is greater than the one who is in the world. They are from the world and therefore speak from the viewpoint of the world, and the world listens to them. We are from God, and whoever knows God listens to us; but whoever is not from God does not listen to us. This is how we recognize the Spirit of truth and the spirit of falsehood. 1 John 4:4‭-‬6 (NIV)
fields.content: Remember, when having a conversation with another, you may both be speaking in the native tongue, but you may be speaking different languages.

fields.verse: But if anyone obeys his word, love for God is truly made complete in them. This is how we know we are in him: Whoever claims to live in him must live as Jesus did. - 1 John 2:5‭-‬6 (NIV)
fields.content: This principle does not depend on circumstances. It is our life's calling. What would Jesus do gives way to do what Jesus did.

fields.verse: 9 (NIV)
fields.content: We are often reluctant to confess our sins for fear of deserved punishment. But what awaits us when we confess is: God's faithfulness, forgiveness, justice, and cleansing.

fields.verse: The Lord is not slow in keeping his promise, as some understand slowness. Instead he is patient with you, not wanting anyone to perish, but everyone to come to repentance. - 2 Peter 3:9 (NIV)
fields.content: Resist anxiety and the urge to escape. God is using these tumultuous times to display his patience and draw many to repentance and salvation.

fields.verse: But there were also false prophets among the people, just as there will be false teachers among you. They will secretly introduce destructive heresies, even denying the sovereign Lord who bought them—bringing swift destruction on themselves. Many will follow their depraved conduct and will bring the way of truth into disrepute. In their greed these teachers will exploit you with fabricated stories. Their condemnation has long been hanging over them, and their destruction has not been sleeping. - 2 Peter 2:1‭-‬3 (NIV)
fields.content: Be vigilant and discerning. There are those amongst us who will sow seeds of discord and division. Remember, the nature of deception is that we don't know we are being deceived. But God can and will make it clear.

fields.verse: For this very reason, make every effort to add to your faith goodness; and to goodness, knowledge; and to knowledge, self-control; and to self-control, perseverance; and to perseverance, godliness; and to godliness, mutual affection; and to mutual affection, love. For if you possess these qualities in increasing measure, they will keep you from being ineffective and unproductive in your knowledge of our Lord Jesus Christ. - 2 Peter 1:5‭-‬8 (NIV)
fields.content: We are surrounded by an abundance of rancor, spite, self-centeredness and retribution. Those who have answered the call to follow Jesus must travel on a different road in contrast to the world around them. Jesus, lead on.

fields.verse: Cast all your anxiety on him because he cares for you. - 1 Peter 5:7 (NIV)
fields.content: It only seems everything is out of control. God is working behind the scenes, His will to make known. In the midst of chaos, He is our peace.

fields.verse: Finally, all of you, be like-minded, be sympathetic, love one another, be compassionate and humble. Do not repay evil with evil or insult with insult. On the contrary, repay evil with blessing, because to this you were called so that you may inherit a blessing. - 1 Peter 3:8‭-‬9 (NIV)
fields.content: A call to spiritual warfare begins with a call to unity. The One who said to turn the other cheek, walk the extra mile, be peacemakers, and bless those who persecute you, is the same One who told us that a divided house will not stand. Pray for unity amongst the People of God.

fields.verse: Who is going to harm you if you are eager to do good? But even if you should suffer for what is right, you are blessed. “Do not fear their threats ; do not be frightened.”  But in your hearts revere Christ as Lord. Always be prepared to give an answer to everyone who asks you to give the reason for the hope that you have. But do this with gentleness and respect, keeping a clear conscience, so that those who speak maliciously against your good behavior in Christ may be ashamed of their slander. For it is better, if it is God’s will, to suffer for doing good than for doing evil. - 1 Peter 3:13‭-‬17 (NIV)
fields.content: Accusation, confrontation, and coerced subjection are weapons used by our Enemy to provoke us to compromise our witness. Fighting fire with fire results in everyone getting burned. Fire must be quenched with water. Believers have the upper hand in spiritual warfare. Word and witness eventually wins because the battle belongs to the Lord. Speak and live truth.

fields.verse: The end of all things is near. Therefore be alert and of sober mind so that you may pray. Above all, love each other deeply, because love covers over a multitude of sins. Offer hospitality to one another without grumbling. Each of you should use whatever gift you have received to serve others, as faithful stewards of God’s grace in its various forms. If anyone speaks, they should do so as one who speaks the very words of God. If anyone serves, they should do so with the strength God provides, so that in all things God may be praised through Jesus Christ. To him be the glory and the power for ever and ever. Amen. - 1 Peter 4:7‭-‬11 (NIV)
fields.content: If we believe we are in the end time, the call is not to arm ourselves for physical warfare, but to prepare ourselves for meaningful prayer and loving service. "The weapons of our warfare are not carnal...."

fields.verse: But you are a chosen people, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, God’s special possession, that you may declare the praises of him who called you out of darkness into his wonderful light. Once you were not a people, but now you are the people of God; once you had not received mercy, but now you have received mercy. - 1 Peter 2:9‭-‬10 NIV)
fields.content: It is not a nation that defines the people of God, it is the people of God who define a nation. The Church is a nation within a nation transcending nations. What binds the people of God together is not boundaries, culture, ethnicity, or constitution; but rather His mercy shown to us through Jesus Christ. The Church can make the difference between a suffering or successful nation. Be the Church.

fields.verse: Though you have not seen him, you love him; and even though you do not see him now, you believe in him and are filled with an inexpressible and glorious joy, for you are receiving the end result of your faith, the salvation of your souls. - 1 Peter 1:8‭-‬9 (NIV)
fields.content: Believe in science, but also believe in God. Science can help you understand what you can't see. Faith can help you understand what you do see. Faith and science are not mutually exclusive. They are mutually complementary.

fields.verse: For, “All people are like grass, and all their glory is like the flowers of the field; the grass withers and the flowers fall,  but the word of the Lord endures forever.” And this is the word that was preached to you. - 1 Peter 1:24‭-‬25 (NIV)
fields.content: In the scope of eternity, we and our appearance are but a speck. We sprout and spread in all our splendor, only to display our beauty for a microscopic pinpoint in the annals of history. As the crown jewel of Creation, let our presence speak of God who transcends it all and yet leaves his indelible mark in our time.

fields.verse: Is anyone among you in trouble? Let them pray. Is anyone happy? Let them sing songs of praise. Is anyone among you sick? Let them call the elders of the church to pray over them and anoint them with oil in the name of the Lord. And the prayer offered in faith will make the sick person well; the Lord will raise them up. If they have sinned, they will be forgiven. Therefore confess your sins to each other and pray for each other so that you may be healed. The prayer of a righteous person is powerful and effective. - James 5:13‭-‬16 (NIV)
fields.content: It seems that the answer to much of what ails us is prayer.

fields.verse: Now listen, you who say, “Today or tomorrow we will go to this or that city, spend a year there, carry on business and make money.” Why, you do not even know what will happen tomorrow. What is your life? You are a mist that appears for a little while and then vanishes. Instead, you ought to say, “If it is the Lord’s will, we will live and do this or that.” - James 4:13‭-‬15 NIV)
fields.content: Our plans are only as good as our discernment of God's direction. Plans are not to be set in stone. We must factor in adjustments as the Lord reveals his will more clearly.

fields.verse: Humble yourselves before the Lord, and he will lift you up. James 4:10 (NIV)
fields.content: In a time when every one has received assertive training, had their self-esteem boosted to impossible levels, and received rewards just for showing up, it is difficult to practice humility. But those who are humble will receive a boost from the Lord that is not contrived, but real.

fields.verse: But the wisdom that comes from heaven is first of all pure; then peace-loving, considerate, submissive, full of mercy and good fruit, impartial and sincere. Peacemakers who sow in peace reap a harvest of righteousness. - James 3:17‭-‬18 NIV)
fields.content: "Lord, make us instruments of your peace..." - Francis of Assisi"Blessed are the peacemakers." - JesusTake a few moments everyday to pull away from the hustle and bustle of life to cultivate the presence of the Prince of Peace. Concentrate on his humility, love, and selflessness. "In the morning when I rise, give me Jesus."

fields.verse: With the tongue we praise our Lord and Father, and with it we curse human beings, who have been made in God’s likeness. Out of the same mouth come praise and cursing. My brothers and sisters, this should not be. - James 3:9‭-‬10 (NIV)
fields.content: Crude speech coming from Christians contradicts and compromises our calling. Our communication should convey the character of our Creator.
